content: I'm a little new to Lean, but am very interested. Have things such as Farkas', weak/strong duality results (Mond-Weir, Lagrange, etc), and other miscellaneous optimization theorems been proven? I'm particularly interested in theorems around (MI)LP, and duality.
Afaik, we don't have Farkas lemma in the "matrix form". The above is probably the closest thing.

FYI, it is already in mathlib3 master branch:
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/blob/13cd3e89b30352d5b1b7349f5537ea18ba878e40/src/analysis/convex/cone/basic.lean#L847

As for the "matrix form" Farkas lemma, I found it in Isabelle and in Coq:
https://www.isa-afp.org/entries/Farkas.html
https://github.com/pi8027/vass/blob/1ee42366a450d2743b52399a21ff80571b7bca94/matrix_ext.v#L622
I think matrix form Farkas lemma seems like a a natural place to start for me then, thanks again!
Ryan Killea has marked this topic as resolved.
